awd_titl_txt: U.S.-Mexico Program:  Kinetics of Non-Linear Reactive       Systems
awd_abstract_narration: 9600232  Redner    This Americas Program award will support collaborative  research between Dr. Sydney Redner, Boston University, and  Dr. Francois Leyvraz, UNAM, Cuernavaca, Mexico, on the  dynamics and resulting spatial organization of dilute  inelastic gases.  The project has three distinct parts:  development of qualitative methods to understand the  dynamics and clustering phenomena of inelastic gases,  studies of the spatio-temporal behavior of a simple  exothermic reaction model, and introduction and  investigation of simple models of cooperative and  competitive behavior that may lead to analytic advances.    The problems to be studied are relevant to current studies  in the theory of complex, non-linear systems.  The research  will lead to significant increases in our understanding of  important technological processes and involves novel models  that are of interest and potential relevance to the social  sciences as well.  ***
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
